page.title: 11PIG FARMING IN SUTTON
page.content: CHURCH FARM Church Farm is a pig farm opposite the church.It used to be a dairy farm until 1947 when the family of the present owners decided to become pig farmers.The farmhouse is part Tudor and part Stuart. THere are about 400 pigs on the farm which need constant attention.Feeding takes about 2 hours and mucking-out has to be done every day including Christmas Day.Older pigs are fed on large cobs and piglets are given creep-feed which is smaller pieces of food mixed with apple juice.The sows have piglets twice a year.Soon after they are born,the piglets have their tails cut off to stop them being bitten by other piglets.When the pigs weigh 55Kg,they are sent to another farm to be fattened for bacon.
